comment: At first I wasn't sure whether I should take him, because no one had reviewed him. I don't regret it! Dr. Sean is hilarious! The class is super easy to pass, not a lot of homework. Expect quizzes every week, but he isn't a tough grader. He genuinely cares about his students passing. I would take him again if I could.

Dr. Sean is an over all amazing professor. His lectures are NOT boring because he's funny and he keeps it real. At first, I didn't like his lecturing style, but two classes in,  he became one my favorite professors. Make sure you take notes and PAY ATTENTION! He repeats what he thinks you will need on test and quizzes. Quizzes & test are easy!

TAKE HIS CLASS! I loved Dr.Sean's class. He's a very relaxed and funny guy and he cares about what he is teaching. His class is an easy A if you do the lab assignments, which are very simple, and come to class when he lectures so you have notes to study from. I made an A in the class and all it took was a little studying and doing the work.

This class is great. Dr. Sean wants his students to succeed. He is extremely knowledgeable about the subject. Constant extra credit. Late work is accepted. The class consists of pure note taking and several "labs." Tests are straight from the notes. As long as you pay attention and try you should do well. Definitely recommend taking him!

Definitely recommend Dr. Sean, he is very funny and laid back, lots of easy assignments to help boost your grade, 2 midterms and a final but he only takes the 2 highest grades so if you do well on the first 2 midterms you don't have to take the final, attendance not mandatory but you need to go to class because the tests are straight from the notes

Dr. Sean is a great professor. He doesnt really stick with the timeline that he gave on the syllabus but that's oka. He's very knowledgeable about the subject. Study for the test. There is a lot of information, and its just not common knowlegde. Even accepts late work for points off. Do the work and get an easy A.

Easy class! Just keep up with the work because he does give multiple assignments. I finished the class with an A, but I did work for it, so just put some effort. Dr. Sean is helpful and answers any of your questions. His lectures are boring, but overall, he is a good teacher.

Class was difficult, but only because of the project and the fact I took it over the summer.  Always willing to answer questions, and uses real life scenarios to explain information.  Not a walk in the park, but if you put in the effort,  you can easily earn an A.

Stickney was not my type of professor, he may sit well with others but not me. He refers to himself as "Dr.Sean" all the time, never as "I" or "me". He is extremely unclear and has way too much meaningless homework. He also talks about himself ALL THE TIME! He does not follow any kind of calendar, he completely wings the entire class.

This class is great! Dr. Sean uses real life scenarios to not only TEACH u the material, but to help you re-evaluate your own ways of life.  He has a wide variety of assignments from short term projects, long term projects, quizs, tests, and regular hw. I would absolutely take this class again, i like how his lectures had pp but spoke more indepth

This teacher is a GREAT teacher. Yes he does speaks highly of his family, but is very relevant to the topic. He is a very passionate professor and take his subjects to heart. I took his class Spring 2011 and rec an A. HIGHLY recommended. Just pay attention and review the PP, he gives GREAT to-the-point reviews and a TON of extra credit:)

He's a nice guy but he is not a good teacher. I passed all his quizes and assignments but did not do well on his tests. There are only 2. He never once teached and just let the students do it. I know more about his personal life than the actual material we were suppose to learn. If I take this class again I am taking the other teacher.

Easy class, very easy to get an A if you pay attention and suck up. He has his favorite "go-to" people in class, yet he will interrupt you at the drop of a hat. Seems to like to hear himself speak sometimes. Just come to class and take notes.
The project takes up a lot of time!! Quizzes and tests are straight forward and directly from his power points and lectures.

Great Prof! He really cares for the students and goes off on tangents but the are valuable. He wants the student to see the true value and reality of going thru college and not making mistakes like he did. He's awesome! McLester and Stickney are the top 2 profs in the HPS department!

do not buy the book...you will not use it at all!!!Very interesting though he favors some people,,just suck up and you will be on your way to an A.I passed his class though with a little sucking up i would have had my A:)
vibe.
I am thankful that I will not have to take him again. I would not recommend him.

Dr. Sean is a wonderful person and professor. He applies his textbook knowledge and life experience to his lessons. I have never heard him insult another prof or student. To pass his courses and actually learn something,just listen to lectures and use his online resources.

He talks too much about himself.  He talks a lot about the other professors, often in a negative way.  He contradicts himself, i.e. changing due dates all the time because he forgot that he already gave a due date.  He seems really unorganized.

Nice guy who is down to earth. In touch with his feelings for a guy. Lectures were short and most came from group presentations. Two tests: midterm and final. Midterm was more difficult than final. He says on first day that 70% of students will get an A. You don't have to come to class except for exams and group presentation.

He is really nice and down to earth. Notes are on Webct and he gives reviews the day before the test so you don't really need to come to class unless he says theres a lab. Sometimes his reviews can be misleading, so try to study a little more than he gives you. you don't need the text book at all.
fun class, interesting lectures, great activities

This teacher is great. If you are looking for a teacher that explains things well, is down to earth, and has fun in class, this is definately a teacher worth looking into. One of the best professors I've ever had.

Awesome! He's only 34 and relates to students really well. Always understanding, lectures are interesting, talks about current events, little work, tests straight from powerpoints. One of the best professors I've ever had... I'm taking him again this Spring :) And he's pretty cute! Take him!!!!!
Great teacher...I learned a lot about health and motivation in his class! Great teacher!

Probably the best teacher I have ever had! Whatever you do take him even if you have to wait. Most of the time you are outside playing kickball or inside playing dodgeball. He will even move back tests and quizes just to go outside and play. He also gives you the answers to the tests and quizes before you take them. Best teacher EVER!

He is by far the coolest teacher I have ever taken in college! Makes everything fun and interesting. Sometimes if the weather is nice he will just skip the lecture and take the class to do an outside activity like kickball!! Highly recommend anyone take him!
